content.description: Start underneath the boulder by the graffiti. Start with a left heel hook and place hands on the rail just above the graffiti. Considering that (as of writing this) this is the only climbable boulder in the area, it is pleasantly surprising to find a heel hook and and overhang, even it it is only four moves.
content.location: 29.529N -98.428. Head south from LBJ Park. The rock will be on the right of the dirt path and can be identified by the red spray-paint graffiti of an Ankh and a stick figure.

content.description: LBJ park is mostly comprised of baseball fields and a skate park, but for climbing purposes it provides trail access to the limestone bluffs on the opposite side of the Salado Creek from the Salado Creek Greenway. The rock here is very crumbly, mossy, and covered in a thin layer of dirt. There are some sections of the limestone bluff however where the rock is solid and promises a few short routes. Additionally there is at least one climbable boulder. With proper protection this area offers several overhangs and interesting climbing for locals who don't have the time to drive out to E-rock and are desperate to climb anything. As as of writing this, this area is completely undeveloped. Many boulders are strewn about, although they are in general too small to be interesting.
